FileFormat.FormatDescription: dBase is a database management systems for microcomputers.The dBase system includes the core database engine, a query system, a forms engine, and a programming language that ties all of these components together. dBase's underlying file format, the .dbf file, is widely used in applications needing a simple format to store structured data.
FileFormat.ProvenanceName: Digital Preservation Department / The National Archives

InternalSignature.SignatureName: dBase Table Version II (date last updated (month (1-12), day (1-31), year)
InternalSignature.SignatureNote: Version number (02), date last updated ((month (1-12), day (1-31), year), Maximum length of each record =1000, first character of field name is upper or lowercase ASCII letter (41-5A) or (61-7A), Field Type (C, N or L)

InternalSignature.SignatureName: dBase Table Version II (date last updated MMDDYY all zero)
InternalSignature.SignatureNote: Version number (02), date last updated MMDDYY all zero, Maximum length of each record =1000, first character of field name is upper or lowercase ASCII letter (41-5A) or (61-7A), Field Type (C, N or L)
